sense.name: basis
sense.commentary: The groundwork or assumptions on which something (an opinion, an argument, etc.) is based.
sense.examples: The argument took as its foundation the assumption that all men are created equal. John's strong political opinions were the foundation of his personality. This fundamental theorem is the foundation upon which all recent discoveries are based.

sense.name: institution
sense.commentary: An organization supported by an endowment.
sense.examples: Our school got a gift from the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation. Mr. Pennybags created a foundation to manage his assets.

sense.name: physical substructure
sense.commentary: Usually the lower support of a building.
sense.examples: We poured the foundations for the new skyscraper. The building was constructed on a foundation of solid rock.

sense.name: experience or education
sense.examples: The applicant has a strong foundation in Computer Science. He lacks to foundation necessary for advanced study.

sense.name: women's garment
sense.commentary: A woman's undergarment worn to give shape to the contours of the body.
sense.examples: Mary's dress, worn over her tight foundation, was sexy enough to grab John's attention.

sense.name: starting or organizing
sense.commentary: FOUNDATION[+event] The act of setting something up, or organizing something. Resultative of the verb 'found'.
sense.examples: The foundation of the city occurred in 1807. From the day of its foundation, the group sought to gain control over national politics.

sense.name: makeup
sense.commentary: The heavy, bottom layer of makeup, used to conceal blemishes.
sense.examples: Mary wore too much foundation, giving her face a painted-on look. My blistering sunburn forced me to use a lot of foundation.
